message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CR 

This paper deals with the problem of combining the outcomes of several different classifiers in a way that provides a coherent inference that satisfies some constraints. This problem is relevant to several subfields of computer science, including natural language processing (NLP), machine learning (ML), artificial intelligence (AI), computer vision (CV), and cryptography (CR). However, given that the paper focuses on the application of these techniques to the task of shallow parsing, which is a subfield of NLP, it is most likely to belong to the cs.CL (Computation and Language) sub-category. The other sub-categories listed are also relevant to the paper's content and methodology.
